plugins.name: Namer | Неймер
plugins.description:
Namer renames selected frames based on their position (top-to-bottom, left-to-right) on the canvas, ignoring layer hierarchy. Adds sequential numbers with your custom prefix: Prefix_1, Prefix_2, etc.


Неймер переименовывает выбранные фреймы по их расположению на рабочей области (сверху-вниз, слева-направо), игнорируя иерархию слоев. Добавляет порядковые номера с вашим префиксом: Префикс_1, Префикс_2 и т.д.


How to Use / Как использовать:

  1. Select frames → Open plugin → Click "Переименовать".
  2. Выберите фреймы → Запустите плагин → Нажмите «Переименовать».
plugins.tagline: Rename frames by position, not layers. / Переименовывает фреймы по расположению, а не слоям.

plugins.name: LARA for Figma
plugins.description:
LARA is the flagship product of Lithero, the first AI company to design and build products specifically for pharma marketing teams. LARA is a custom-made AI that learns the nuances of pharma brands at lightspeed, supporting brand teams throughout the end-to-end content creation process.


The official LARA for Figma plugin brings the power of LARA Screen and LARA Claims to your workspace. Get actionable feedback on the compliance of your content at the point of creation, saving significant time downstream. LARA for Figma complements the content creation process by ensuring high quality and accuracy of created content. Shorten review cycles, reduce spend, and get the most out of Figma with LARA!


Key Features:

Claims

- Detect differences between created content and approved claims, enabling corrections before MLR

- Trace claims back to their references and associated safety text in LARA Claims for additional context


Safety Text

- Identify and insert any required safety text missing from the content

- Generate accurate & complete safety text blocks to insert into content


References

- Find potential approved references that could be used to substantiate claims

- Locate any claims that are missing citations to typically seen references


*Requires subscription to LARA Claims and Screen. For more information, visit https://www.lithero.com/
plugins.tagline: Bring the power of LARA to your process

plugins.name: 图像矢量化 Image Tracer
plugins.description:
Introduction

This Figma plugin allows users to convert raster images into scalable vector graphics with a single click. Enhance your design process by transforming pixel-based images into smooth, resolution-independent vectors directly within Figma.


Function Description

  1. Vectorizes selected image nodes into SVG format.
  2. Preserves image structure and generates editable vector paths.
  3. Outputs scalable vector graphics compatible with Figma’s design tools.


How to Use

  1. Select an image node on your Figma canvas.
  2. Click the “Vectorize Image” button in the plugin UI.
  3. The plugin will generate an SVG vector output placed adjacent to the original image node.


Notes

  1. Ensure only one image node is selected before using the plugin.
  2. Only image nodes are supported for vectorization. Non-image nodes will not be processed.
  3. Large images may take additional time for processing.


介绍

此 Figma 插件支持一键将光栅图像转换为可缩放的矢量图形，让您在 Figma 内直接将像素图转换为平滑的、分辨率无关的矢量图，从而提升设计流程。


功能说明

  1. 将选中的图像节点矢量化为 SVG 格式。
  2. 保留图像结构，生成可编辑的矢量路径。
  3. 输出的矢量图与 Figma 的设计工具兼容。


使用方法

  1. 在 Figma 画布上选择一个图像节点。
  2. 点击插件界面的“矢量化图像”按钮。
  3. 插件将在原始图像节点旁生成一个 SVG 矢量输出。


注意事项

  1. 请确保使用插件前只选中了一个图像节点。
  2. 仅支持对图像节点进行矢量化，非图像节点将无法处理。
  3. 对于较大的图像，处理时间可能会稍长。

accepted.name: KingweiCheung
accepted.description: If you have any questions or suggestions, feel free to contact me at kingweichueng@qq.com.

plugins.tagline: Convert Images to Vectors Seamlessly

plugins.name: 一键翻译元素 Quick Translate
plugins.description:
Introduction

Quick Translate is a Figma plugin designed to help you instantly translate selected text elements into different languages with just one click. Save time and improve your workflow by translating text directly within your design files.


Function Description

  1. Translate selected text elements into a specified target language.
  2. Supports multiple languages and automatic translation of all text layers in a Figma selection.
  3. Easy-to-use interface to select languages and apply translations quickly.
  4. Ideal for designers working on multilingual projects or collaborating with global teams.


How to Use

  1. Select one or more text elements in your Figma file.
  2. Open the plugin from the "Plugins" menu.
  3. Choose the target language for translation.
  4. Click the "Translate" button, and the selected text will be replaced with the translated version.


Notes

  1. Ensure your Figma selection includes text elements, as the plugin only works with text layers.
  2. The translation may vary depending on the accuracy of the API and the language selected.
  3. For optimal results, select only relevant text elements to avoid unnecessary API calls.


介绍

Quick Translate 是一款 Figma 插件，旨在帮助您一键翻译选中的文本元素。通过该插件，您可以直接在 Figma 文件中将文本翻译为不同语言，节省时间，提高工作效率。


功能说明

  1. 将选中的文本元素翻译为指定的目标语言。
  2. 支持多种语言，并自动翻译 Figma 选择中的所有文本图层。
  3. 提供简单易用的界面，可以快速选择语言并应用翻译。
  4. 适用于多语言项目的设计师，或者与全球团队协作的设计师。


使用方法

  1. 在 Figma 文件中选择一个或多个文本元素。
  2. 从“插件”菜单打开插件。
  3. 选择目标翻译语言。
  4. 点击“翻译”按钮，选中的文本将被翻译并替换。


注意事项

  1. 请确保您的 Figma 选择包含文本元素，因为插件只支持文本图层。
  2. 翻译效果可能会根据 API 的准确性和所选语言有所不同。
  3. 为了获得最佳效果，建议只选择相关的文本元素，以避免不必要的 API 请求。

accepted.name: KingweiCheung
accepted.description: If you have any questions or suggestions, feel free to contact me at kingweichueng@qq.com.

plugins.tagline: Quick Translate: Instant Translation for Figma Elements

plugins.name: Align Auto Layout
plugins.description:
MacOS shortcut setup:

System Settings → Keyboard → Keyboard Shortcuts → App Shortcuts → “+”.

App: Figma.

Menu Title:

Plugins->Align Auto Layout->Move alignment up

(repeat for down/left/right).

Press the desired keys, e.g. ⌃⌥W, and save.

Your new keys now trigger the plugin commands in Figma.
plugins.tagline: Instantly nudge auto-layout frames—left, right, up, down—for lightning-fast design workflows.

138621.name: Align Auto Layout
138621.description:
MacOS shortcut setup:

System Settings → Keyboard → Keyboard Shortcuts → App Shortcuts → “+”.

App: Figma.

Menu Title:

Plugins->Align Auto Layout->Move alignment up

(repeat for down/left/right).

Press the desired keys, e.g. ⌃⌥W, and save.

Your new keys now trigger the plugin commands in Figma.
138621.tagline: Instantly nudge auto-layout frames—left, right, up, down—for lightning-fast design workflows.

plugins.name: Token Exporter Pro
plugins.description:
Export Figma color, gradient, and shadow tokens with one click — no fluff, just clean, dev-ready output.


Choose your naming convention (camelCase, PascalCase, dot.notation…), match your framework (React, Tailwind, or plain CSS), and get tokens you can actually use.


Includes:

✅ Linear & radial gradients (with angles)

✅ Shadow exports (drop & inner)

✅ Format-ready for Tailwind, JSON, and SCSS

✅ Works great with Style Dictionary or custom configs


Perfect for design system handoffs, developer styling, and anyone who’s tired of manually formatting hex codes.
plugins.tagline: Export design tokens from Figma — with naming styles, framework formats, gradients & shadows.

138641.name: Token Exporter Pro
138641.description:

Choose your naming convention (camelCase, PascalCase, dot.notation…), match your framework (React, Tailwind, or plain CSS), and get tokens you can actually use.


Includes:

Perfect for design system handoffs, developer styling, and anyone who’s tired of manually formatting hex codes.
138641.release_notes: Added "documentAccess": "read" to support newer Figma permissions
138641.tagline: Export design tokens from Figma — with naming styles, framework formats, gradients & shadows.

plugins.name: Jo - Instant Design Feedback
plugins.description:
Stop designing in the dark.

Jo gives you instant validation without leaving Figma.


Two ways to get unstuck:

🔍 Heuristic Check — Usability feedback against Nielsen's 10 principles

Select a frame → get ranked issues with specific fixes


📊 Quick Poll — Stakeholder sign-off in minutes

Select 2-4 frames → Generate link → teammates vote/comment (no Figma login required)


Why designers are loving Jo:

✅ In-Context Feedback: Feedback panel sits right next to your canvas.

🎯 Actionable Insights: Specific fixes, not vague opinions.

⏱️ Zero Meeting Overhead: Async feedback that actually works.

🔁 Iteration-Friendly: Tweak, test, and ship with confidence.


Perfect for:

Validating concepts, streamlining stakeholder buy-in, catching usability issues before dev handoff.


Ready to design with confidence?

Install Jo today and transform your feedback loops!
plugins.tagline: Get AI and teammate feedback on your designs. No meetings, no guesswork.

plugins.name: Tablify
plugins.description:
Tablify is a powerful and flexible plugin that turns structured data into clean, styled tables directly in your Figma files. Whether you’re working with CSVs, Google Sheets, Excel files, or even Word documents, Tablify makes it effortless to visualize your data with consistency and control.


Features


Multiple Input Formats


  1. Upload from CSV, TSV, Excel (.xlsx/.xls), Word (.docx), PDF, HTML, XML, ODS, ODT
  2. Supports Google Sheets via public URL — just paste the link, choose a sheet, and you’re ready to go
  3. Drag & drop supported for local files


Intelligent Parsing


  1. Detects and handles multiple tables per document (e.g. Excel sheets or Word tables)
  2. Automatically cleans and parses content for structured layout
  3. Handles complex table structures, colspans, and headers


Design-Ready Tables


  1. Generates clean, structured Figma components
  2. Supports auto layout or fixed layout styles
  3. Responsive to Figma color variables, padding, radius, fonts, and more


Customization Options


  1. Auto Layout
  2. Header Row
  3. Style Variables (automatically created and bound)
  4. Automatically generates reusable tokens for colors, sizes, and text styles


Perfect for


  1. UI and product designers
  2. Dashboards, admin panels, data-heavy UIs
  3. Rapid prototyping with live spreadsheet content
  4. Importing structured data into Figma layouts with no manual copying


Why Tablify?


Unlike basic table creators, Tablify focuses on precision, flexibility, and deep Figma integration. It’s built for speed and scale — helping you go from spreadsheet to structured layout in seconds.


💬 Questions or feedback? Telegram ・ Email

accepted.name: Andrei Kuznetsov
accepted.description: Templates, UI Kits, Design Systems, Plugins

plugins.tagline: Smart Table Generator for Figma

plugins.name: Invoicely
plugins.description:
Create clean, professional invoices directly inside Figma — no extra tools needed.


Invoicely lets freelancers, designers, and agencies generate stylish invoices in seconds with pre-built templates, client autofill.


✦ Select a template

✦ Add your client and items

✦ Hit “Generate Invoice” — done.


Built for speed. Designed for simplicity.

accepted.name: Diego Grillo
accepted.description:
I like building things that people use.
Mostly simple, useful, sometimes weird.
Currently shipping plugins, tools & ideas.

plugins.tagline: Quick Invoice Maker for Figma

137998.name: Invoicely
137998.description:
Create clean, professional invoices directly inside Figma — no extra tools needed.


Invoicely lets freelancers, designers, and agencies generate stylish invoices in seconds with pre-built templates, client autofill.


✦ Select a template

✦ Add your client and items

✦ Hit “Generate Invoice” — done.


Built for speed. Designed for simplicity.
137998.release_notes:
This is the first public release of Invoicely.

✔️ All core features are working:

Template selection

Client & sender input

Tax customization

Instant invoice generation

Fully editable directly in Figma

⚠️ Minor note:
Some alignments in the invoice template aren’t pixel-perfect yet.
We wanted to ship early and improve fast — updates are already planned to polish everything.

Stay tuned for more features and improvements coming soon!

plugins.name: Uncomponent
plugins.description: Uncomponent is a smart Figma plugin that lets you instantly convert components back into editable frames—without the hassle of copying, detaching, or losing layout and styles. Whether you're cleaning up design systems, experimenting with layouts, or debugging nested structures, Uncomponent gives you full control while keeping your workflow smooth, fast, and intuitive.
plugins.tagline: Break free from components—no copy, no detach, just uncomponent.

Whether you're cleaning up design systems, experimenting with layouts, or debugging nested structures, Uncomponent gives you full control while keeping your workflow smooth, fast, and intuitive.

plugins.name: Rename by text list
plugins.description:
This plugin lets you rename multiple layers in bulk using a text-based list.

Simply select two Auto Layout frames:

  1. One containing the elements to rename (any layer type)
  2. One containing text nodes with the desired names

The plugin will rename each element in the first frame using the corresponding text content from the second frame, based on their order in the layers panel.
plugins.tagline: Rename one list of items by another list of text items

137516.name: Rename by text list
137516.description:
This plugin lets you rename multiple layers in bulk using a text-based list.

Simply select two Auto Layout frames:

  1. One containing the elements to rename (any layer type)
  2. One containing text nodes with the desired names

The plugin will rename each element in the first frame using the corresponding text content from the second frame, based on their order in the layers panel.
137516.tagline: Rename one list of items by another list of text items

plugins.name: Chat IO
plugins.description:
AI-Powered Chat Interface

- Interactive AI Assistant : Chat with an AI that analyzes your selected Figma content (text layers, frames, components)

- Context-Aware Responses : The AI understands your selected design elements and provides relevant feedback

- Multi-language Support : Automatically detects and responds in the user's language

- Conversation Memory : Maintains context between messages for coherent discussions


Smart Text Replacement System

- AI-Driven Content Generation : Replace selected text layers with AI-generated content based on custom instructions

- Multiple Layer Support : Handle single or multiple text layers simultaneously

- Pre-built Templates : Quick-access buttons for common tasks:

- Summarize : Condense text content concisely

- Improve Text : Enhance clarity, reduce repetition, fix sentence structure

- Improve CTA : Optimize call-to-action buttons following UX best practices

- Task Generator : Convert project descriptions into actionable to-do lists


Generate Task Flow

This plugin simplifies page management in Figma with an intuitive interface for creating, organizing, and maintaining your project structure. Whether you're building complex design systems or managing multiple screens, Pagify streamlines page workflows so you can focus on design.

plugins.name: Flow Linker
plugins.description:
In large-scale design projects, prototyping every screen-to-screen interaction isn’t always practical. With dozens or even hundreds of screens, building interactive flows becomes time-consuming and sometimes infeasible, especially when deadlines are tight or priorities shift.


Yet developers and stakeholders still need clarity. They rely on understanding how different screens connect, what the logical flow of a user journey looks like, and where transitions happen even without full prototypes.


That’s where Flow Link comes in.


Rather than investing hours in building out detailed prototypes, Flow Link lets you visually map out interactions using clean, orthogonal connectors. These lines don’t just show flow—they’re configurable, styled, navigable, and reusable. And with frame linking, viewers can even jump directly to connected screens, making your Figma file interactive in structure, even without full prototyping.


Flow Link fills the gap between rapid design iteration and clear developer handoff making complex projects more navigable, understandable, and scalable.
plugins.tagline: Your Figma Flow, Made Effortless.

137680.name: Flow Linker
137680.description:
In large-scale design projects, prototyping every screen-to-screen interaction isn’t always practical. With dozens or even hundreds of screens, building interactive flows becomes time-consuming and sometimes infeasible, especially when deadlines are tight or priorities shift.


Yet developers and stakeholders still need clarity. They rely on understanding how different screens connect, what the logical flow of a user journey looks like, and where transitions happen even without full prototypes.


That’s where Flow Link comes in.


Rather than investing hours in building out detailed prototypes, Flow Link lets you visually map out interactions using clean, orthogonal connectors. These lines don’t just show flow—they’re configurable, styled, navigable, and reusable. And with frame linking, viewers can even jump directly to connected screens, making your Figma file interactive in structure, even without full prototyping.


Flow Link fills the gap between rapid design iteration and clear developer handoff making complex projects more navigable, understandable, and scalable.

plugins.name: Tiny Exports
plugins.description:
Optimize your exported assets for web and mobile applications with just a few clicks.


Features

  1. Export layers with Figma’s export settings
  2. Support for layer naming conventions. Useful for setting exports in component libraries.
  3. Export individual layers or all at once
  4. Export only exportable layers under the current selection
  5. Support for TinyPNG compression (API key required) – available for free
  6. WIP: Apply export settings automatically to all image layers
  7. WIP: Apply export settings to all manually selected layers


How to Use

  1. Set Figma’s export settings or use the naming convention `export-[scale]x-[format]` (e.g., `export-1.5x-png`).
  2. Trigger the plugin in Figma while in design mode.
  3. Get a TinyPNG API key from [tinypng.com/developers](https://tinypng.com/developers) and enter it in the plugin’s Settings tab.
  4. Enable TinyPNG compression for optimized images.
  5. Use the plugin UI to export individual layers or all at once.


Naming Convention

SVGs or PDFs do not support `scale`. If a naming convention is present, it is preferred over Figma's export settings. It is recommended to use Figma's export settings if you can.

  1. Format: `export-[scale]x-[format]`
  2. `scale`: Any number (e.g., 2, 1.5) – 1 by default
  3. `format`: png, jpg, svg, or pdf – jpg is set by default


Examples:

  1. `imageName [export-1.5x-png]`
  2. `imageName [export-2x-jpg]`
  3. `imageName [export-jpg]`
  4. `svgName [export-svg]`


Security

  1. The TinyPNG API key is stored only locally
  2. The plugin uses a proxy to communicate with the API


Known Issues

- Unable to export and set multiple exports from one layer
plugins.tagline: Easily export all layers with TinyPNG compression.

137400.name: Tiny Exports
137400.description:
Optimize your exported assets for web and mobile applications with just a few clicks.


Features

  1. Export layers with Figma’s export settings
  2. Support for layer naming conventions. Useful for setting exports in component libraries.
  3. Export individual layers or all at once
  4. Export only exportable layers under the current selection
  5. Support for TinyPNG compression (API key required) – available for free
  6. WIP: Apply export settings automatically to all image layers
  7. WIP: Apply export settings to all manually selected layers


How to Use

  1. Set Figma’s export settings or use the naming convention `export-[scale]x-[format]` (e.g., `export-1.5x-png`).
  2. Trigger the plugin in Figma while in design mode.
  3. Get a TinyPNG API key from [tinypng.com/developers](https://tinypng.com/developers) and enter it in the plugin’s Settings tab.
  4. Enable TinyPNG compression for optimized images.
  5. Use the plugin UI to export individual layers or all at once.


Naming Convention

SVGs or PDFs do not support `scale`. If a naming convention is present, it is preferred over Figma's export settings. It is recommended to use Figma's export settings if you can.

  1. Format: `export-[scale]x-[format]`
  2. `scale`: Any number (e.g., 2, 1.5) – 1 by default
  3. `format`: png, jpg, svg, or pdf – jpg is set by default


Examples:

  1. `imageName [export-1.5x-png]`
  2. `imageName [export-2x-jpg]`
  3. `imageName [export-jpg]`
  4. `svgName [export-svg]`


Security

  1. The TinyPNG API key is stored only locally
  2. The plugin uses a proxy to communicate with the API


Known Issues

- Unable to export and set multiple exports from one layer
137400.tagline: Easily export all layers with TinyPNG compression.

plugins.name: Human Design Map Builder
plugins.description:
This plugin is part of a structured system for generating personalized Human Design maps inside Figma.

It reads structured data from a frame called INPUT_PANEL and dynamically updates the cover, highlights centers, colors gates, and reveals matching sections based on the data.

It ends by copying all relevant sections to a target page (מפות מעודכנות) for final output.

No data is sent to external services, except for a success/failure status posted to a webhook for internal workflow tracking.

This plugin is tailored for a specific document structure and may not function properly outside that context.
plugins.tagline: Automatically build and assemble custom sections inside your Figma based on predefined data fields.

137361.name: Human Design Map Builder
137361.description:

This plugin is tailored for a specific document structure and may not function properly outside that context.
137361.release_notes:
MAP BUILDER – Version 1.1
Release Notes

Added secure status reporting using dynamic tokens pulled directly from the design panel.

Improved user feedback with clearer notifications throughout the map-building process.

Minor bug fixes and internal stability enhancements.
137361.tagline: Automatically build and assemble custom sections inside your Figma based on predefined data fields.

plugins.name: Button State Builder
plugins.description:
Button State Builder helps you create all interactive states (hover, pressed, disabled, & focused) from a single base button. Style your base button (colors, fonts, icons) however you like — then run the plugin to automatically generate polished, accessible states.


To properly run the plugin, the button layout must include a state layer that accepts interactive color states. We recommend starting from a base button provided in the playground file.

plugins.name: Zephyr Export
plugins.description: Exports a section with all its images as an atlas to the Defold engine. Before exporting, it wraps images into frames, all existing frames into components, adds TYPE TYPE_BOX property to all components and sets constraints scale (scale is not set if stretch is set). After that you can use your components in the zephyr plugin

plugins.name: JSON to Variable
plugins.description:
You can import a JSON file to create grouped Figma variables. you can download the pre-structured Tailwind color palette JSON file via the link as a starting point:


Tailwind colors structured.json


The following is an example of a correctly formatted JSON:

[
{
"CollectionName": {
"modes": {
"ModeName": {
"GroupName": {
"Primary": {
"$value": "#FFFFFF",
"$type": "color"
},

"secondary": {
"$value": "#F5F5F5",
"$type": "color"
}
},
"GroupName2": {
"primary": {
"$value": "#2196F3",
"$type": "color"
}
}
}
}
}
}
]
plugins.tagline: Import JSON file to variable

plugins.name: Nativ Localization
plugins.description: The Nativ Localization plugin allows you to adapt visual content inside Figma to any culture and language (from any culture or language). This includes context-aware translation of editable text inside visual assets, as well as uneditable text that are part of complex pixel arts. The plugin allows you to upload your own glossary enabling you to control translation styles/tones. The translations automatically maintain the same original style in the target culture/language. The plugin also goes beyond text, such as stylistically replacing country flags in a poster based on the localization target.
plugins.tagline: Transform visual assets to any culture and language.

135216.name: Nativ Localization
135216.description: The Nativ Localization plugin allows you to adapt visual content inside Figma to any culture and language (from any culture or language). This includes context-aware translation of editable text inside visual assets, as well as uneditable text that are part of complex pixel arts. The plugin allows you to upload your own glossary enabling you to control translation styles/tones. The translations automatically maintain the same original style in the target culture/language. The plugin also goes beyond text, such as stylistically replacing country flags in a poster based on the localization target.

135216.tagline: Transform visual assets to any culture and language.

plugins.name: Name Shame
plugins.description:
Name Shame is a lovingly vibe-coded plugin born from one designer’s deep-seated frustration with default layer names like “Rectangle 123” and “Group 87.” Instead of silently suffering, I decided to roast my own poor file hygiene—and now yours too.


This plugin scans your Figma file for default-named layers, serves up a spicy roast for each offender, and lets you rename them with beautifully ridiculous alternatives like “such_lazy” or “identity_crisis.” Use it for laughs, use it for cleanup, use it because your future self deserves better.


File hygiene matters. Might as well make it fun. 🎉

accepted.name: Aaron May
accepted.description:
Professional & Punchy
Creative Director with a love for design systems, clear UI, and a well-organized layer panel.

plugins.tagline: Scans bland layer names, dishes witty roasts and renames them with delightful absurdity

plugins.name: BrowserLens
plugins.description:
This plugin lets you import color styles from the BrowserLens web extension. Insert colors as layers in your design and add palettes to your local styles.


Learn more about BrowserLens: https://browserlens.com/

Documentation: https://docs.browserlens.com/


How to Use

  1. Open any webpage with the BrowserLens extension.
  2. Click export > Figma (BrowserLens Plugin).
  3. Download the style file for Figma.
  4. Run this plugin and upload the style file.
  5. Choose whether to add colors as local styles.
  6. Click 'Import Styles'.


About BrowserLens


BrowserLens is a web extension designed to extract styling and seo information from any webpage without the need for developer tools. It provides a simple UI for extracting and copying webpage information from the current tab.


Extension Features

  1. ⌨️ View fonts used on a webpage and the associated CSS values.
  2. 🖌️ Extract colors from a webpage and click to copy color value.
  3. 🌅 Extract gradients from a webpage and click to copy CSS value.
  4. 🎨 Export color palettes to Figma.
  5. 🌐 Preview SEO data including page meta, OpenGraph tags and Twitter Card data.
  6. ✅ Check SEO meta for best practices including title and description length.
  7. 🖼️ List all images present on a page and click to download, including background images.
  8. 🌃 Dark mode support.

accepted.name: BrowserLens
accepted.description:
Extract colors, fonts, media and seo meta from any site without using developer tools. 

Available for Chrome, Firefox and Edge

plugins.tagline: Import styles from the BrowserLens web extension

plugins.name: Just Fill
plugins.description:
A plugin that resizes images to fill width while keeping their aspect ratio

- Resizes images to fill width of their parent container

- Maintains aspect ratio

- Works with multiple selections
plugins.tagline: Fill container shortcut for images

plugins.name: push-my-icons
plugins.description:
Push your Figma SVG icons to GitHub with ease.


This plugin helps you

  1. Automatically extract SVG nodes
  2. Upload them to your GitHub repository
  3. Generate a pull request with added/updated/removed icons


How to Use

  1. Open the plugin and fill in the following fields:
  2. GitHub personal access token
  3. GitHub repository URL
  4. Target folder path in the repo (e.g., src/icons)
  5. Pull request title and description
  6. Select all frames that contain your SVG icon components.
  7. Each selected frame should be a top-level container for one or more SVGs.
  8. Click "Push" button.
  9. The plugin will:
  10. Export all SVGs found in the selected frames
  11. Upload them to the specified folder in your GitHub repo
  12. Create a pull request containing added, updated, or deleted icon files
plugins.tagline: Push selected Figma icons to GitHub in one click.
